get.summary: Get all items based on (lazy) load parameters (paging, sorting, and filtering)

parameters.name: Sort
parameters.description:
Name of a column. Must be same as in corresponding DTO object, case insensitive
In case of multiple columns, separated them with comma and without spaces

get.summary:
Get all items based on (lazy) load parameters (paging, sorting, and filtering)
but project result to columns list (i.e. subset of possible data)

parameters.name: columns
parameters.description: Comma separated list of columns (use AS name for alias), e.g. id,code as C,name

parameters.name: Sort
parameters.description:
Name of a column. Must be same as in corresponding DTO object, case insensitive
In case of multiple columns, separated them with comma and without spaces

get.summary: Get number of item satisfying filters

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Each filter is like  key(operator)value, e.g. client(contains)Bob, agency(=)TNT

parameters.name: useANDFor
parameters.description: List of columns that use AND instead of OR to merge multiple filters with the same key

get.summary:
Export data to excel
Use columns as comma separated list if you need to specify which columns should be included in the result
Alias may be used (e.g. columns could be FieldA, FieldB AS FB, FieldC

parameters.name: Sort
parameters.description:
Name of a column. Must be same as in corresponding DTO object, case insensitive
In case of multiple columns, separated them with comma and without spaces

post.summary:
Export data to excel. Use LoadParams (i.e., First, Rows, Filter, UseANDFor) to get a subset of the data,
otherwise all rows would be fetched
Use Columns to select which fields (and in which order) should be exported to excel. 
Columns key must be present, although it may be an empty array. In that case all properties from the DTO are returned
For each column Field (i.e. propery name) must be specified, and optionally header text (Title) for the field
If the field is numeric or date, you may use NumberFormat or DateFormat to set Excel format for the field.

get.summary:
Get the value specified by the aggregate function (min, max, avg, sum) of items satisfying filters
If there are no data in the result, then the results in empty (204-No Content)

parameters.name: function
parameters.description: Sum, Min, Max, Avg, as defined in MobilityOne.Common.Queries.Generic.AggregateFunction

parameters.name: aggregateField
parameters.description: One of allowed aggregate fields in DTO

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Each filter is like  key(operator)value, e.g. client(contains)Bob, agency(=)TNT

parameters.name: useANDFor
parameters.description: List of columns that use AND instead of OR to merge multiple filters with the same key

post.summary: Add new case

201.description: Returns the newly created case data (route to the case, it's id, and the case in the body)

202.description:
Status 202 is created when case is assigned to an entity 
            that was not used before. In that case, entry would be created but the 
            data about assignee would be retrieved in the background (before or after the response).
            Schema of the result is same as in case of status 201
            If MobilityOne.VehicleMgt.Contract.DTOs.Case.AssigneeName is empty but MobilityOne.VehicleMgt.Contract.DTOs.Case.AssigneeId is set, it means that that is still being retrieved
            If MobilityOne.VehicleMgt.Contract.DTOs.Case.RaisedByAssigneeName is empty but MobilityOne.VehicleMgt.Contract.DTOs.Case.RaisedByAssigneeId is set, it means that that is still being retrieved

400.description: If the model is null or not valid

delete.summary: Deletes multiple items

requestBody.description: primary keys of items that should be deleted

200.description: If delete request has been processed (regardless of individual results)

404.description: If user is not allowed to do this operation

get.summary:
Get average monthly mileage of all vehicles in the tenant since (included) year/month 
Example
Vehicle A has 3 months of entries 3000, 3500, and 2500
Vehicle B has 2 monthly entries 10000 and 15000
Average is AVG(AVG(3000,3500,2500), AVG(10000, 15000)) -> AVG(3000, 12500) -> 7750
Average monthly expenses per tenant (in the period)
Average monthly expenses (in the period) for the choosen vehicle

Gets the list of vehicles (id, licence plate, and display name) without mileage report since some date
If parameter since is ommitted, then since would be set to the 1st day of the current month

Get count of vehicle in the current tenant without mileage report since some date
If parameter since is ommitted, then since would be set to the 1st day of the current month

put.summary:
Update document's info. In order to identify the document, entity id and document id are needed
info can be a string or a json

info can be a string or a json

get.summary: Returns metadata of the entity with the specified primary key value

200.description: if the metadata can be fetched (although it may be empty)

400.description: If the item type does not support metada

404.description: if there is no item with sent id

get.summary:
Get all items based on (lazy) load parameters (paging, sorting, and filtering)
but project result to columns list (i.e. subset of possible data)

parameters.name: columns
parameters.description: Comma separated list of columns (use AS name for alias), e.g. id,code as C,name

parameters.name: Sort
parameters.description:
Name of a column. Must be same as in corresponding DTO object, case insensitive
In case of multiple columns, separated them with comma and without spaces

get.summary: Get number of item satisfying filters

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Each filter is like  key(operator)value, e.g. client(contains)Bob, agency(=)TNT

parameters.name: useANDFor
parameters.description: List of columns that use AND instead of OR to merge multiple filters with the same key

get.summary:
Export data to excel
Use columns as comma separated list if you need to specify which columns should be included in the result
Alias may be used (e.g. columns could be FieldA, FieldB AS FB, FieldC

parameters.name: Sort
parameters.description:
Name of a column. Must be same as in corresponding DTO object, case insensitive
In case of multiple columns, separated them with comma and without spaces

post.summary:
Export data to excel. Use LoadParams (i.e., First, Rows, Filter, UseANDFor) to get a subset of the data,
otherwise all rows would be fetched
Use Columns to select which fields (and in which order) should be exported to excel. 
Columns key must be present, although it may be an empty array. In that case all properties from the DTO are returned
For each column Field (i.e. propery name) must be specified, and optionally header text (Title) for the field
If the field is numeric or date, you may use NumberFormat or DateFormat to set Excel format for the field.

get.summary:
Get the value specified by the aggregate function (min, max, avg, sum) of items satisfying filters
If there are no data in the result, then the results in empty (204-No Content)

parameters.name: function
parameters.description: Sum, Min, Max, Avg, as defined in MobilityOne.Common.Queries.Generic.AggregateFunction

parameters.name: aggregateField
parameters.description: One of allowed aggregate fields in DTO

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Each filter is like  key(operator)value, e.g. client(contains)Bob, agency(=)TNT

parameters.name: useANDFor
parameters.description: List of columns that use AND instead of OR to merge multiple filters with the same key

get.summary:
Get all relevant data for vehicle board as latest periodic activities, etc...
from and to are used for KPIs calculation. Note: range is [from, to>
If ommited the from would be the first day of the year, and to first day of the next year in UTC time

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Date from which KPIs should be calculated

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End of range (excluded) for KPIs calculation

post.summary: Create new entry in vehicle calendar

202.description:
Status 202 is created when vehicle is assigned to an entity 
            that was not used before. In that case, entry would be created but the 
            data about assignee would be retrieved in the background (before or after the response).
            Schema of the result is same as in case of status 201
            If MobilityOne.VehicleMgt.Contract.DTOs.CalendarEntry.AssigneeName is empty, it means that that is still being retrieved

201.description: Returns the newly created vehicle calendar entry (route to the entry, and the entry in the body)

parameters.name: Sort

post.summary:
Export data to excel. Use LoadParams (i.e., First, Rows, Filter, UseANDFor) to get a subset of the data,
otherwise all rows would be fetched
Use Columns to select which fields (and in which order) should be exported to excel. 
Columns key must be present, although it may be an empty array. In that case all properties from the DTO are returned
For each column Field (i.e. propery name) must be specified, and optionally header text (Title) for the field
If the field is numeric or date, you may use NumberFormat or DateFormat to set Excel format for the field.
